        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem here is that initially both the table and colgroup require legacy fallback, because of the "columns" declaration. When removing the "columns" declaration from the table, the table no longer requires legacy fallback, but the colgroup child still does (but we don't check, since nothing changed there), and since they make up the same table, we cannot start using NG for the table. But we do.<span class="line"><!---->The problem here is that initially both the table and colgroup require legacy fallback, because of the "columns" declaration. When removing the "columns" declaration from the table, the table no longer requires legacy fallback, but the colgroup child still does (but we don't check, since nothing changed there), and since they make up the same table, we cannot start using NG for the table. But we do.<!----></span><br><br>One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<span class="line"><!---->One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc"><!---->https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

This triggers bad typecast, wrong methods get called...<span class="line"><!---->LayoutNGTable. This triggers bad typecast, wrong methods get called...<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to propagate SetShouldForceLegacyLayoutForChild<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to propagate SetShouldForceLegacyLayoutForChild<!----></span><br>correctly. It was only propagating until it found parent<span class="line"><!---->correctly. It was only propagating until it found parent<!----></span><br>with legacy layout.<span class="line"><!---->with legacy layout.<!----></span><br><br>Note: SetShouldForceLegacyLayoutForChild flag never gets cleared.<span class="line"><!---->Note: SetShouldForceLegacyLayoutForChild flag never gets cleared.<!----></span><br><br>Also added DCHECKs to detect mixed table trees earlier.<span class="line"><!---->Also added DCHECKs to detect mixed table trees earlier.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1178263<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1178263" title="Heap-buffer-overflow in blink::LayoutTable::AddColumn"><!---->Bug: 1178263<!----></a><br>Change-Id: Ifebaaccbad4006819ca66fed8310ddeb59e1aa64<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: Ifebaaccbad4006819ca66fed8310ddeb59e1aa64<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2692390<a         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.         <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 10, 2021, 7:13 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Congratulations, attekett@! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $5,000 for this issue + $1000 fuzzer bonus, since your fuzzer discover this issue, for a total reward of $6,000. Thank you for your contributions to Chrome Fuzzing and nice work!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, attekett@! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $5,000 for this issue + $1000 fuzzer bonus, since your fuzzer discover this issue, for a total reward of $6,000. Thank you for your contributions to Chrome Fuzzing and nice work!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

          Comment 14<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="back Jan 2nd" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mstensho@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1328909474" title="mstensho@chromium.org"><!---->mstensho@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mstensho@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mstensho@chromium.org<!----></span>
      back Jan 2nd<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="back Jan 2nd" hidden=""><!---->back Jan 2nd<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem here is that initially both the table and colgroup require legacy fallback, because of the "columns" declaration. When removing the "columns" declaration from the table, the table no longer requires legacy fallback, but the colgroup child still does (but we don't check, since nothing changed there), and since they make up the same table, we cannot start using NG for the table. But we do.<span class="line"><!---->The problem here is that initially both the table and colgroup require legacy fallback, because of the "columns" declaration. When removing the "columns" declaration from the table, the table no longer requires legacy fallback, but the colgroup child still does (but we don't check, since nothing changed there), and since they make up the same table, we cannot start using NG for the table. But we do.<!----></span><br><br>One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<span class="line"><!---->One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc"><!---->https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      Detailed Report: <span class="line"><!---->Detailed Report: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5201403786887168<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="line"><!---->Platform Id: linux<!----></span><br><br>Crash Type: Heap-buffer-overflow READ 2<span class="line"><!---->Crash Type: Heap-buffer-overflow READ 2<!----></span><br>Crash Address: 0xf1509278<span class="line"><!---->Crash Address: 0xf1509278<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br>  blink::LayoutTable::AddColumn<span class="line"><!---->  blink::LayoutTable::AddColumn<!----></span><br>  blink::LayoutTableCol::InsertedIntoTree<span class="line"><!---->  blink::LayoutTableCol::InsertedIntoTree<!----></span><br>           Comment 14<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="back Jan 2nd" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mstensho@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1328909474" title="mstensho@chromium.org"><!---->mstensho@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mstensho@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mstensho@chromium.org<!----></span>
      back Jan 2nd<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="back Jan 2nd" hidden=""><!---->back Jan 2nd<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem here is that initially both the table and colgroup require legacy fallback, because of the "columns" declaration. When removing the "columns" declaration from the table, the table no longer requires legacy fallback, but the colgroup child still does (but we don't check, since nothing changed there), and since they make up the same table, we cannot start using NG for the table. But we do.<span class="line"><!---->The problem here is that initially both the table and colgroup require legacy fallback, because of the "columns" declaration. When removing the "columns" declaration from the table, the table no longer requires legacy fallback, but the colgroup child still does (but we don't check, since nothing changed there), and since they make up the same table, we cannot start using NG for the table. But we do.<!----></span><br><br>One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<span class="line"><!---->One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc"><!---->https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

      mstensho@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mstensho@chromium.org<!----></span>
      back Jan 2nd<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="back Jan 2nd" hidden=""><!---->back Jan 2nd<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        > One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<!----></span><br><br>Nope. Seems problematic. Adding new test.<span class="line"><!---->Nope. Seems problematic. Adding new test.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

gets cleared.<span class="line"><!---->Note: SetShouldForceLegacyLayoutForChild flag never gets cleared.<!----></span><br><br>Also added DCHECKs to detect mixed table trees earlier.<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Root cause is violation of "Only NG table parts inside NG Tables".<span class="line"><!---->Root cause is violation of "Only NG table parts inside NG Tables".<!----></span><br>LayoutTableColumn gets created inside LayoutNGTable.<span class="line"><!---->LayoutTableColumn gets created inside LayoutNGTable.<!----></span><br>Lots of tricky stuff going on with forcing/unforcing legacy layout inside element.cc, this might take a while to unpack.<span class="line"><!---->Lots of tricky stuff going on with forcing/unforcing legacy layout inside element.cc, this might take a while to unpack.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Feb 15, 2021, 5:00 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The problem here is that initially both the table and colgroup require legacy fallback, because of the "columns" declaration. When removing the "columns" declaration from the table, the table no longer requires legacy fallback, but the colgroup child still does (but we don't check, since nothing changed there), and since they make up the same table, we cannot start using NG for the table. But we do.<span class="line"><!---->The problem here is that initially both the table and colgroup require legacy fallback, because of the "columns" declaration. When removing the "columns" declaration from the table, the table no longer requires legacy fallback, but the colgroup child still does (but we don't check, since nothing changed there), and since they make up the same table, we cannot start using NG for the table. But we do.<!----></span><br><br>One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<span class="line"><!---->One observation is that "columns" don't really apply to table or table-column-group at all [1], so forcing legacy in the first place isn't really necessary. Then again, "columns" is allowed for table-cell, so I'm not sure if it can be fixed this way.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc"><!---->https://www.w3.org/TR/css-multicol-1/#cc<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/dcd7b566693c8dbbe9f04b5754a6ea6d73c5dcec<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/dcd7b566693c8dbbe9f04b5754a6ea6d73c5dcec"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/dcd7b566693c8dbbe9f04b5754a6ea6d73c5dcec<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>dcd7b566693c8dbbe9f04b5754a6ea6d73c5dcec<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/dcd7b566693c8dbbe9f04b5754a6ea6d73c5dcec"><!---->dcd7b566693c8dbbe9f04b5754a6ea6d73c5dcec<!----></a><br>Author: Aleks Totic <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Aleks Totic &lt;<!----></span>atotic@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/atotic@chromium.org"><!---->atotic@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Feb 16 00:10:50 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Feb 16 00:10:50 2021<!----></span><br><br>[TablesNG] clusterfuzz multicol causes illegal table layout trees<span class="line"><!---->[TablesNG] clusterfuzz multicol causes illegal table layout trees<!----></span><br><br>The cause of the crash is legacy LayoutTableColumn inside<span class="line"><!---->The cause of the crash is legacy LayoutTableColumn inside<!----></span><br>LayoutNGTable. This triggers bad typecast, wrong methods get called...<span class="line"><!---->LayoutNGTable. This triggers bad typecast, wrong methods get called...<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to propagate SetShouldForceLegacyLayoutForChild<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to propagate SetShouldForceLegacyLayoutForChild<!----></span><br>correctly. It was only propagating until it found parent<span class="line"><!---->correctly. It was only propagating until it found parent<!----></span><br>with legacy layout.<span class="line"><!---->with legacy layout.<!----></span><br><br>Note: SetShouldForceLegacyLayoutForChild flag never gets cleared.<span class="line"><!---->Note: SetShouldForceLegacyLayoutForChild flag never gets cleared.<!----></span><br><br>Also added DCHECKs to detect mixed table trees earlier.<span class="line"><!---->Also added DCHECKs to detect mixed table trees earlier.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1178263<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1178263"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.           Comment 23<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1178263#c23">Comment 23<!----></a>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <slot></slot>
      <button>

      </button>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        for LitElement.

// Load and instantiate pRPC client before any other script.
window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
